cont.entity_a: Super low light performance across all focal ranges with image stabilization.
Covers wide angle to mid-range telephoto, ideal for walk-around purposes.
cont.entity_b: 28-80mm focal range is versatile for most photos.

cont.entity_a: AF is super fast and tack sharp.
Cost and weight are drawbacks.
Approximately twice the size and four times heavier than the kit lens.
cont.entity_b: Compact design and good for general usage.

cont.entity_a: Amazing image quality for the price.
Solid build quality.
cont.entity_b: Plastic build but looks good on the camera.

cont.entity_a: Great depth of field with f2.8 and versatile 17-55mm range.
Owned for over 10 years with no problems.
Excellent long exposure performance.
Lightroom corrects distortion automatically.
Beautiful colors and no ghosting or flaring issues.
cont.entity_b: Color reproduction is better than old SMC lens.

cont.entity_a: Recommended for landscapes and works well for portraits.
cont.entity_b: Not a professional lens but suitable for amateur use.

cont.entity_a: Versatile for video with IS.
cont.entity_b: Works on both digital and film cameras.

cont.entity_a: Physically large and heavy but solid and well-built.
Not suitable for full frame cameras without a modifier.
Sharpness and clarity are impressive for the price.
No weather sealing but well-built.
IS and f2.8 aperture are valuable for low light conditions.
Image stabilizer is loud due to older system.
Great for low light and indoor photography.
cont.entity_b: Reasonable for indoor, portrait, landscape, and architecture.

cont.entity_a: Ideal for travel and event photography.
Excellent for video with smooth, silent operation.
Requires cleaning for dust issues.
Comparable to L series in quality without L designation.
Ideal for general shooting.
cont.entity_b: Good general purpose lens for the price.

cont.entity_a: Best for crop sensor cameras.
